p: With reference to the above, possibly the most important marker of the hyperinflammatory state and worse outcome is the IL-6 level. A study that examined 40 patients admitted to a single hospital found that the 32.5% that required MV did not differ with regard to epidemiological factors such as age, comorbidities, radiological findings, respiratory rate or qSofa score. However, an elevated IL-6 was strongly associated with MV ( P = 1.2 × 10 −5) and that a level >80 pg/ml during the disease predicted respiratory failure with high accuracy ( P = 1.7 × 10 −8, AUC = 0.98) with a rate of 22 times higher vs those with lower levels.( 14)
